programmes.show_description: Bill's imagination works overtime at Swansea's Grand Theatre as he mixes genius musical parodies with illogical absurdity and bizarre stories from his colourful career.
Rose Matafeo joins Joe Lycett for mischief in Malmö. They visit the world's first twisting tower and the Disgusting Food Museum and sample insects and a spirit made from beaver glands.
Le Bistro: Gordon visits high-end Le Bistro in Florida. Owner Andy has cooked for top chefs in the past, but he's lost his passion - and he doesn't respond well to criticism.
Gaynor offers a warm welcome to her guests at the Nateby Inn B&B in Cumbria. A cask-rolling competition turns out to be a barrel of laughs, but one guest hogs the limelight at dinner.
Graham and Julia host at Outfields Farm B&B in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where they treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor skydiving centre.
Bob Osborne takes a laid-back approach to running the At Home B&B in Chiswick, west London. His guests appreciate the art in his communal living space, but they're soon dishing the dirt.
Andrew and Clare host at the Ammonite Lodge guest house in Chard, Somerset, where they hope to bowl their guests over with a traditional game of skittles.
It's the final day of the competition and everyone meets for one last time to settle some scores and find out how much they've been paid and who's been crowned the best B&Bers.
Kirstie Allsopp makes a beehive piñata and a hot-air-balloon-inspired paper garland that's perfect for a children's party.
Kirstie and Phil revisit globetrotter Matt in Windsor, and Justin and Deborah in Sheffield, to see what a few new additions to the family did for their house-hunting dreams.
Fatty McButterpants: Doug asks Carrie to tell him how she feels about his weight, but when she does just that, he can't resist getting his revenge by picking faults with her.
Class Struggle: Doug feels neglected when Carrie decides to go back to college. Guest starring Ricki Lake as Doug's sister.
Strike One: Doug and Carrie agree that they shouldn't buy a new car because Doug's union may be going on strike. But Doug can't resist a new off-roader...
Strike Too: With his union striking, Doug takes work as a substitute teacher at the school where his sister Stephanie (Ricki Lake) works. But the job's not as easy as he thinks.
Fighting In-Laws: Debra's parents come round for Thanksgiving dinner. Debra's so pleased that they're not like Frank and Marie - or are they?
The Sneeze: Much to Debra's annoyance, Marie mollycoddles Ray when he thinks he's coming down with something.
Christmas Present: Ray buys Debra an extravagant Christmas present so that she'll let him go on a golfing weekend. But what if she's getting him a generous gift too?
Leapin' Lizards: Station boss Kate doesn't object to the pranks that Bulldog plays on Frasier, despite Dr Crane's obvious discomfort.
Kisses Sweeter Than Wine: On the day when he's hosting a wine-tasting party, Frasier hires a contractor to remove a scratch from his floor, but he takes apart the whole apartment.
Sleeping with the Enemy: Frasier marches into Kate's office demanding a pay rise. So why do they end up playing tonsil hockey instead?
Homer the Moe: Moe reopens his bar as a slick members' club. So Homer opens a 'hunting club' in his garage with R.E.M. playing live (guest starring as themselves).
The Blunder Years: A hypnotist reawakens repressed memories from Homer's childhood. But what was the event that scared him so badly when he was 12? Guest starring Paul Newman.
The Parent Rap: Bart and Homer are tethered together by a strict judge after Bart and Milhouse are accused of stealing Chief Wiggum's police car.
Frying Game: Homer and Marge are framed for murder and face the electric chair. Guest starring Carmen Electra as herself.
In Worthing and Portsmouth, pensioners Bill and Hilary, dance fans Micaela and Sanchez and kids' entertainer Doug and his partner Patsy compete in a week of hippy happenings and hip-hop.
The competition begins at B&B at No.3 in Market Bosworth. Hosts Mac and Jo take pride in their Tudor architecture, but they've got a breakfast bombshell for their guests.
On day two, a topsy-turvy breakfast at Noreen and Chloe's establishment - The Bull Hotel in Buckinghamshire - leaves some of their guests happier than others...
At The Chequers Inn in Battle, East Sussex, Shaun and Kelly aim to please with their historic surroundings and homemade ingredients. But one guest delivers a shock in their feedback.
The last visit is to Hastings House in East Sussex, where Ian and Bev aim to provide an upmarket experience. But according to two guests, that doesn't extend to their towels...
The B&Bers sharpen their knives on payment day as they debate bad breakfasts, miserable mini bars and terrible towels, before the winning B&B is crowned.
(2016) Toby Jones and Catherine Zeta-Jones lead a stellar cast in a reboot of the comedy classic. The hapless Home Guard platoon gets involved with D-Day. But there's a spy in their midst.
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
...with The Rev Richard Coles: Richard enjoys a Wight good time at Cowes Week racing regatta and tests out his seven-star service skills at a superyacht school. (Ep3/4)
...with Ross Edgley: Ross's muscles are breaking down and his pee is brown. Melting glaciers and a hurricane threaten his epic swim. Can the RAF and some amazing northern lights help? (Ep3)

programmes.show_name: New: Roman Empire by Train with...
programmes.show_description: ...Alice Roberts: In Rome, Alice digs into some of the stories behind the city's world-famous ancient landmarks and Rome's debt to the Etruscans. In Florence, it's time for cocktails. (Ep3)
(2022) Steven Spielberg's coming-of-age drama about a young man who dreams of reshaping the world through the medium of film. Sound familiar? With Michelle Williams and Seth Rogen.
(1987) Sci-fi thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger. A US commando unit gets trapped in the jungle by a murderous, seemingly invincible alien hunter. But they ain't got time to bleed.
Gordon Returns 1: Gordon revisits three restaurants - Handlebar, Casa Roma and The Black Pearl - to check in with the owners he helped. Has his advice been put to good use?
In Cornwall, artistic Zaya and Damian serve a modern British menu, property developers Kelly and Jon show off their refurbished mansion, and Emma and Gavin host a fun-filled Cornish night.
Some extra brunch as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show.
Tales from the Public Domain: Homer reads classic tales from an overdue library book, with himself as Odysseus at the Battle of Troy, Lisa as Joan of Arc, and Bart as Hamlet.
Homer the Moe: Moe reopens his bar as a slick members' club. So Homer opens a 'hunting club' in his garage with R.E.M. playing live (guest starring as themselves).
The Blunder Years: A hypnotist reawakens repressed memories from Homer's childhood. But what was the event that scared him so badly when he was 12? Guest starring Paul Newman.
The Parent Rap: Bart and Homer are tethered together by a strict judge after Bart and Milhouse are accused of stealing Chief Wiggum's police car.
Frying Game: Homer and Marge are framed for murder and face the electric chair. Guest starring Carmen Electra as herself.
Strike Out: Carrie suggests that Arthur should spend the day with Doug and Deacon to cheer them up while they're on strike. But it doesn't turn out as she'd hoped...
Dark Meet: Carrie and Doug reminisce about their first Thanksgiving together, when Doug first met Arthur and his wife Lily.
Twisted Sitters: Doug and Carrie babysit Deacon and Kelly's son Kirby, but he catches them in a compromising position on his parents' bed...
What Good Are You?: Ray tries to prove his 'manliness' after failing to act swiftly enough in an emergency involving Debra.
Super Bowl: Ray's sent by his paper to cover the Super Bowl, but his excitement's tempered by having to choose someone to accompany him. Will he make the right choice?
Ray's Journal: Ray's horrified to learn that his mother used to read his diary, which contained his most personal - and perverted - thoughts.
The Adventures of Bad Boy and Dirty Girl: It's the morning after, and Kate and Frasier are worried about the consequences of their fling.
The Last Time I Saw Maris: Niles decides to stand up to Maris. So she decides to divorce him.
Frasier Grinch: Frasier's excited that his son Frederick is coming for Christmas, but Martin thinks a proper Christmas should mean more than just educational presents.
Matt Forde chats about his UK tour. Yinka and Kola Bokkini discuss their YouTube show. And there's chat with Aston Merrygold and Elizabeth Dulau and music from Leigh-Anne Pinnock.
Papa's Got a Brand New Badge: Homer, Lenny and Carl start a security firm and are given the contract to look after the town when Mayor Quimby realises how inept Chief Wiggum is.
Hunka Hunka Burns in Love: Homer gets a job writing fortune cookie messages, one of which tells Mr Burns he will find love.
Treehouse of Horror XII: Homer annoys a fortune teller, who places curses on each of the Simpsons. He captures a leprechaun to break the curse, but all does not go to plan.
George visits a Moroccan oasis in the Cotswolds and seeks inspiration for his secret garden studio flat. And Chitty Chitty Bang Bang gets an extension on the Isle of Wight.
Channel 4's flagship news programme. Including the weather.
Women's FA Cup: It's derby day as Jill Scott and Maisie Adam present live coverage of the fifth round. Will this be a sweet day for the Toffees or will Liverpool have them seeing red?
Can a fox-red Labrador called Bear impress two would-be owners without putting his paw in it? And 88-year-old identical twins hope that pint-sized Alfie will join them at the pub.

programmes.show_name: New: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programmes.show_description: The potters make body part pots and sculptures of their bodies in motion, fired in brick kilns that they're building themselves. Who can carve out a place in the semi-final?
The final twelve solve a complex maths game to escape from a maze. Then the top eight compete against each other in a mind-bending memory game, for a place in the final four. (Ep5/6)
On the show this time, The Masked Singer, Love Is Blind, Gladiators, Steal, Bargain Holiday Secrets, The Floor and ITV News (Larry the Cat).
(2022) Poignant road-trip comedy with Channing Tatum. A soldier with PTSD must escort a traumatised army canine to a comrade's funeral. Can man and dog save each other's lives?
